CatDescriptText: Miss Vivian Bundridge, 3738 Frazier Street, was part of the Pittsburghers Speak Up column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, August 1, 1959, pg. A1 with question: "Do you think that 18-year-olds should be given the privilege of voting?" answer reads: "Yes, I think so. With a greater feeling of responsibility, it makes one feel as though he is part of things.  At 18, I will be able to vote wisely."
TitMainTitle: Portrait of Vivian Bundridge wearing light colored sleeveless blouse, and patterned skirt, standing on Fifth Avenue across from Thrift Drugs and Kappels, Downtown
